subject: Warranty
description_text:
Hello simsonn support. Yesterday I was adjusting my pedals because they
were a bit too vertical. What I did is turn around the plate (see attached
picture) and nothing else. I did this to my throttle and brake also, and
nothing happened. However, when I finally placed down my clutch and pressed
it, a part fell out. I'm not sure if the pedal still works, I don't really
want to try because I'm afraid it will cause more damage. I would like to
ask what I can do about it, I'm looking for either a replacement or a
tutorial on how to fix. The throttle and brake works fine, so if possible
I'd only like to get my clutch pedal replaced. I have the SIMSONN plus X
pedal set. See part that fell off beneath.

Regards, ksawery Zygmunt.

conversations.body_text: Hi ksawery zygmunt,  Please take a photo showing the silver sensor position on the clutch and the small spring near the blue limiter, so I can check which part is damaged. Don’t worry — we can send you the replacement parts free of charge and provide a video guide to help you replace them easily.       ​In addition, please provide your order number, contact name, phone number, and shipping address so we can process your request as quickly as possible.

Hello. Here is the information you asked for:

Order number: SSN2326
Contact name: ksawery
Shopping address: The Netherlands, Enschede, cheribonstraat 1 7541 ZS
(country, city, street and zip code)
Phone number: +31 6 33202631

Is this the part what you mean?




> 5049:4206036
>
Hi ksawery zygmunt,         Okay, we've replaced the entire clutch pedal assembly for you.  https://t.17track.net/en#nums=YT2529500704513495

That's great, thank you very much! Is there a place where I can give a
rating?
